title: How to Contour an Oblong Face

steps.title: Add your foundation as you normally would.
steps.content: Add your foundation as you normally would. Foundation should be applied prior to contouring. Follow your normal foundation routine. Add a layer of foundation to cover any discoloration or imperfections on your skin before adding your contour lines. [2] X Research source Your regular foundation should more or less match your skin tone. If you are unsure what product to use for your skin tone, try testing it out on your arm and holding it to the light. [3] X Expert Source Yuka Arora Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 30 August 2018.

steps.title: Apply a line along your hairline.
steps.content: Apply a line along your hairline. A thin contour line across your hairline will make your forehead look slightly smaller. Use a thin makeup brush to apply a contour line there to start. [4] X Research source Contour lines can be created using bronzer or a foundation slightly darker than your regular skin tone. For best results, invest in a makeup brush specifically designed to do contour lines.

steps.title: Make lines on your cheekbones.
steps.content: Make lines on your cheekbones. Start at the ears and end in the middle of your cheeks. On each cheek, make a line that runs just below your natural cheekbone. This will slim down your face by making your cheekbones more noticeable. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Add a line to your chin.
steps.content: Add a line to your chin. Add a small vertical line to your chin roughly in the center. Then, blend the line backward into your neck. This will narrow your chin slightly. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Add upside down triangles under your eyes.
steps.content: Add upside down triangles under your eyes. To brighten your face, use concealer or highlight to draw two upside down triangles under your eyes. This will brighten up your eyes and eliminate any dark circles. [7] X Research source You can use your fingers or a makeup brush to draw your triangles. If you have a pencil concealer or highlighter, use this to draw your triangles.

steps.title: Add a line along the upper part of the cheekbones.
steps.content: Add a line along the upper part of the cheekbones. To further draw out your cheekbones, add a line of highlighter or concealer near the contour lines you drew. Add a small line of concealer beside the contour line on the top of each cheekbone. It is not necessary to run the line along the full scope of your cheekbone like you did with the contour line. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Highlight your nose.
steps.content: Highlight your nose. Draw one line going down the bridge of your nose. This should slim down your nose slightly, making it look smaller. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Blend your contour lines.
steps.content: Blend your contour lines. Get a beauty blender or similar tool, like a makeup sponge, slightly damp. [10] X Expert Source Yuka Arora Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 30 August 2018. Tap the blender across your face in small, circular motions. Use the rounded edge of the sponge for areas like your cheeks and forehead. For areas like your nose, squeeze the brush between your hands to flatten it as you tap the makeup to blend. [11] X Research source Do not rush the process. It can take awhile to blend contour lines so they look natural. Going too fast may obscure your lines, undoing your work.

steps.title: Set the look with a light layer of translucent powder.
steps.content: Set the look with a light layer of translucent powder. A translucent powder or foundation can help your contour lines stay intact for the rest of the day. After everything is blended, dip a fluffy brush in a small amount of powder. Gently dust a light layer of the powder across your face to set your look. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Apply blush to the apples of your cheeks.
steps.content: Apply blush to the apples of your cheeks. Apply a small amount of blush to each cheek using a makeup brush. Only apply brush to the roundest portions of your cheeks as this is most flattering if you have an oblong face. [13] X Research source Avoid shimmery blushes, as this can distract from your highlighting.
